channel.description: Recent content in rladies on Janani Ravi

item.title: 2018: Year in Review | RLEL
item.description: Thanks to everyone who attended, participated or sponsored R-Ladies East Lansing in 2018! We had a fantastic start & a very successful first 6mo on campus! We hosted 7 meetups since July 2018 including two very well-attended workshops (70+ attendees) and a DataViz challenge! Help us continue spreading the R & Data Science spirit across MSU in 2019! Contact us eastlansing@rladies.org about co-hosting or sponsoring a meetup/workshop in Spring 2019.

item.title: 2019: RLEL Upcoming Events
item.description: A little background R-Ladies East Lansing welcomes R-enthusiasts of all proficiency levels, including aspiring and experienced R programmers, who are interested in mentoring, networking & expertise upskilling. This non-profit, civil society community is designed to develop members’ R skills & knowledge through social, collaborative learning & sharing. Supporting minority identity access to STEM skills & careers, the Free Software Movement, and contributing to the global R community! Anyone and everyone interested in R/Data Science should join the group.

item.title: R-Ladies East Lansing | Workshop on Intro to Tidy Data w/ R
R-Ladies East Lansing | Workshop on Intro to Data Visualization w/ R
Launching R-Ladies East Lansing!
item.description: Welcome to our new chapter! What we’re about R-Ladies East Lansing is a local chapter of R-Ladies Global. We meet to discuss, learn, teach, present, work on all things R! Our priority is to provide a safe community space for anyone identifying as a minority gender who is interested in and/or working with R. The group exists to promote gender diversity in the R community worldwide. We are pro-actively inclusive of queer, trans, and all minority identities, with additional sensitivity to intersectional identities.
